DataElement.preferredName: Person Doxorubicin Total Quantity Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether the total amount of doxorubcin, an anthracycline antineoplastic antibiotic isolated from the fungus Streptococcus peucetius var. caesius, ever received by a person as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Doxorubicin Total Quantity Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the total amount of doxorubcin, an anthracycline antineoplastic antibiotic isolated from the fungus Streptococcus peucetius var. caesius, ever received by a person as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Doxorubicin Total Quantity Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An anthracycline antineoplastic antibiotic isolated from the fungus Streptococcus peucetius var. caesius.  Doxorubicin intercalates into DNA and interacts with topoisomerase II, thereby inhibiting DNA replication and repair and RNA and protein synthesis.  This agent also produces toxic free-radical intermediates and interacts with cell membrane lipids causing lipid peroxidation.  The hydrochloride salt doxorubicin hydrochloride is the therapeutic form of doxorubicin. (NCI04):Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:Quantity; how much there is of something that you can measure.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: An anthracycline antibiotic with antineoplastic activity. Doxorubicin, isolated from the bacterium Streptomyces peucetius var. caesius, is the hydroxylated congener of daunorubicin. Doxorubicin intercalates between base pairs in the DNA helix, thereby preventing DNA replication and ultimately inhibiting protein synthesis. Additionally, doxorubicin inhibits topoisomerase II which results in an increased and stabilized cleavable enzyme-DNA linked complex during DNA replication and subsequently prevents the ligation of the nucleotide strand after double-strand breakage. Doxorubicin also forms oxygen free radicals resulting in cytotoxicity secondary to lipid peroxidation of cell membrane lipids; the formation of oxygen free radicals also contributes to the toxicity of the anthracycline antibiotics, namely the cardiac and cutaneous vascular effects.
Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has she received a life time
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has she received a life time exposure to doxorubicin (or liposomal doxorubicin) greater than 300 mg/m2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of exposure to cumulative doses of doxorubicin greater than 360mg per square meter of body-surface area or its equivalent?
